scoring_rule: Each problem: ALL words must be correct. Level: 80% of problems must pass.

problems.prompt:
# Syllable Puzzle

Find 8 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
sig, ic, penser, jar, ing, ic, few, walt, thet, net, cry, ing, af, fect, syn, mag, dis, nal

## Clues
A. (3 syllables) — SYN: affect
B. (3 syllables) — SYN: charismatic
C. (1 syllables) — SYN: bump around
D. (2 syllables) — SYN: bespeak
E. (2 syllables) — SYN: battle cry
F. (1 syllables) — An indefinite, but usually small, number of.
G. (3 syllables) — SYN: celluloid
H. (2 syllables) — a container so designed that the contents can be used in prescribed amounts

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Find 9 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
crets, sions, able, sion, a, mitch, style, tat, ci, am, i, hes, cre, ple, de, pend, chi, ed, se, progress, psy, pen, trist, in, se, tion, hair

## Clues
A. (2 syllables) — grant a pension to
B. (3 syllables) — the cutting of or into body tissues or organs (especially by a surgeon as part of an operation)
C. (4 syllables) — A medical doctor specializing in psychiatry.
D. (2 syllables) — something that baffles understanding and cannot be explained
E. (2 syllables) — the arrangement of the hair (especially a woman's hair)
F. (2 syllables) — more than enough in size or scope or capacity
G. (3 syllables) — the organic process of synthesizing and releasing some substance
H. (3 syllables) — worthy of reliance or trust
I. (4 syllables) — pause or hold back in uncertainty or unwillingness

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Find 9 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
per, cides, au, ta, tions, mas, fac, id, ter, tor, dy, slo, here, vakia, ter, quar, gus, by, cep, peach, iot, ed

## Clues
A. (2 syllables) — To form an [masked]; to move in, or as if in, an [masked]; to move in a circle.
B. (2 syllables) — A person of the lowest intellectual standing, a person who lacks the capacity to develop beyond the mental age of a normal four-year-old; a person with an IQ below 30.
C. (2 syllables) — To be a product of other objects.
D. (3 syllables) — a city in eastern Georgia north-northwest of Savannah; noted for golf tournaments
E. (2 syllables) — a landlocked republic in central Europe; separated from the Czech Republic in 1993
F. (3 syllables) — becoming aware of something via the senses
G. (4 syllables) — Structure hint: (suffix: -er) — To act as a [masked].
H. (1 syllables) — divulge confidential information or secrets
I. (2 syllables) — By this means, action or process.

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Find 10 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
beach, ed, hy, dro, brazil, tus, gen, wrap, shad, posit, mariner, sta, ian, nit, ping, spac, de, ing

## Clues
A. (2 syllables) — The action of the verb .
B. (2 syllables) — A person from Brazil or of [masked] descent.
